questions.question_text:
The energy of one mole of photons of radiation of wavelength 300 nm is

 (Given : h = 6.63 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 J s, NA = 6.02 $$\times$$ 1023 mol$$-$$1, c = 3 $$\times$$ 108 m s$$-$$1)

questions.question_text:
The correct order of bond orders of $${C_2}^{2 - }$$, $${N_2}^{2 - }$$ and $${O_2}^{2 - }$$
 is, respectively

questions.question_text:
For a first order reaction, the time required for completion of 90% reaction is 'x' times the half life of the reaction. The value of 'x' is

(Given : ln 10 = 2.303 and log 2 = 0.3010)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Metals generally melt at very high temperature. Amongst the following, the metal with the highest melting point will be :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: PCl5 is well known, but NCl5 is not. because,

option_texts.A: nitrogen is less reactive than phosphorus.
option_texts.B: nitrogen doesn't have d-orbitals in its valence shell.
option_texts.C: catenation tendency is weaker in nitrogen than phosphorus.
option_texts.D: size of phosphorus is larger than nitrogen.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Transition metal complex with highest value of crystal field splitting ($$\Delta$$0) will be :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Arrange the following carbocations in decreasing order of stability.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : The presence of weaker $$\pi$$-bonds make alkenes less stable than alkanes.

Statement II : The strength of the double bond is greater than that of carbon-carbon single bond.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are correct.
option_texts.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are incorrect.
option_texts.C: Statement I is correct but Statement II is incorrect.
option_texts.D: Statement I is incorrect but Statement II is correct.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following reagents / reactions will convert 'A' to 'B' ?

option_texts.C: BH_{3}, H_{2}O_{2}/^{$$-$$}OH followed by PCC oxidation
option_texts.D: HBr, hydrolysis followed by oxidation by K_{2}Cr_{2}O_{7}.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Hex-4-ene-2-ol on treatment with PCC gives 'A'. 'A' on reaction with sodium hypoiodite gives 'B', which on further heating with soda lime gives 'C'. The compound 'C' is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The conversion of propan-1-ol to n-butylamine involves the sequential addition of reagents. The correct sequential order of reagents is

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: In the flame test of a mixture of salts, a green flame with blue centre was observed. Which one of the following cations may be present?

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A company dissolves 'x' amount of CO2 at 298 K in 1 litre of water to prepare soda water. X = __________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3 g. (nearest integer)

(Given : partial pressure of CO2 at 298 K = 0.835 bar.

Henry's law constant for CO2 at 298 K = 1.67 kbar.

Atomic mass of H, C and O is 1, 12, and 6 g mol$$-$$1, respectively)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
PCl5 dissociates as

PCl5(g) $$\rightleftharpoons$$ PCl3(g) + Cl2(g)

5 moles of PCl5 are placed in a 200 litre vessel which contains 2 moles of N2 and is maintained at 600 K. The equilibrium pressure is 2.46 atm. The equilibrium constant Kp for the dissociation of PCl5 is __________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3. (nearest integer)

(Given : R  = 0.082 L atm K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1; Assume ideal gas behaviour)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The resistance of a conductivity cell containing 0.01 M KCl solution at 298 K is 1750 $$\Omega$$. If the conductivity of 0.01 M KCl solution at 298 K is 0.152 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3 S cm$$-$$1, then the cell constant of the conductivity cell is ____________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3 cm$$-$$1.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Manganese (VI) has ability to disproportionate in acidic solution. The difference in oxidation states of two ions it forms in acidic solution is ____________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
0.2 g of an organic compound was subjected to estimation of nitrogen by Dumas method in which volume of N2 evolved (at STP) was found to be 22.400 mL. The percentage of nitrogen in the compound is _________. [nearest integer]

(Given : Molar mass of N2 is 28 g mol$$-$$1. Molar volume of N2 at STP : 22.4 L)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Consider the above reaction. The number of $$\pi$$ electrons present in the product 'P' is __________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: In alanylglycyl leucyl alanyl valine, the number of peptide linkages is ___________.

questions.question_text: A particle is moving in the xy-plane along a curve C passing through the point (3, 3). The tangent to the curve C at the point P meets the x-axis at Q. If the y-axis bisects the segment PQ, then C is a parabola with :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let the maximum area of the triangle that can be inscribed in the ellipse $${{{x^2}} \over {{a^2}}} + {{{y^2}} \over 4} = 1,\,a > 2$$, having one of its vertices at one end of the major axis of the ellipse and one of its sides parallel to the y-axis, be $$6\sqrt 3 $$. Then the eccentricity of the ellipse is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let the area of the triangle with vertices A(1, $$\alpha$$), B($$\alpha$$, 0) and C(0, $$\alpha$$) be 4 sq. units. If the points ($$\alpha$$, $$-$$$$\alpha$$), ($$-$$$$\alpha$$, $$\alpha$$) and ($$\alpha$$2, $$\beta$$) are collinear, then $$\beta$$ is equal to :

questions.question_text:
The number of distinct real roots of the equation 

x7 $$-$$ 7x $$-$$ 2 = 0 is

Mathematics
questions.question_text: If the shortest distance between the lines $${{x - 1} \over 2} = {{y - 2} \over 3} = {{z - 3} \over \lambda }$$ and $${{x - 2} \over 1} = {{y - 4} \over 4} = {{z - 5} \over 5}$$ is $${1 \over {\sqrt 3 }}$$, then the sum of all possible value of $$\lambda$$ is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$\widehat a$$ and $$\widehat b$$ be two unit vectors such that $$|(\widehat a + \widehat b) + 2(\widehat a \times \widehat b)| = 2$$. If $$\theta$$ $$\in$$ (0, $$\pi$$) is the angle between $$\widehat a$$ and $$\widehat b$$, then among the statements :

(S1) : $$2|\widehat a \times \widehat b| = |\widehat a - \widehat b|$$

(S2) : The projection of $$\widehat a$$ on ($$\widehat a$$ + $$\widehat b$$) is $${1 \over 2}$$

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$\lambda$$$$^ * $$ be the largest value of $$\lambda$$ for which the function $${f_\lambda }(x) = 4\lambda {x^3} - 36\lambda {x^2} + 36x + 48$$ is increasing for all x $$\in$$ R. Then $${f_{{\lambda ^ * }}}(1) + {f_{{\lambda ^ * }}}( - 1)$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let S = {z $$\in$$ C : |z $$-$$ 3| $$\le$$ 1 and z(4 + 3i) + $$\overline z $$(4 $$-$$ 3i) $$\le$$ 24}. If $$\alpha$$ + i$$\beta$$ is the point in S which is closest to 4i, then 25($$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$) is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of 7-digit numbers which are multiples of 11 and are formed using all the digits 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 9 is _____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The sum of all the elements of the set $$\{ \alpha  \in \{ 1,2,.....,100\} :HCF(\alpha ,24) = 1\} $$ is __________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The remainder on dividing 1 + 3 + 32 + 33 + ..... + 32021 by 50 is _________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The area (in sq. units) of the region enclosed between the parabola y2 = 2x and the line x + y = 4 is __________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let a circle C : (x $$-$$ h)2 + (y $$-$$ k)2 = r2, k > 0, touch the x-axis at (1, 0). If the line x + y = 0 intersects the circle C at P and Q such that the length of the chord PQ is 2, then the value of h + k + r is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let the hyperbola $$H:{{{x^2}} \over {{a^2}}} - {y^2} = 1$$ and the ellipse $$E:3{x^2} + 4{y^2} = 12$$ be such that the length of latus rectum of H is equal to the length of latus rectum of E. If $${e_H}$$ and $${e_E}$$ are the eccentricities of H and E respectively, then the value of $$12\left( {e_H^2 + e_E^2} \right)$$ is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let P1 be a parabola with vertex (3, 2) and focus (4, 4) and P2 be its mirror image with respect to the line x + 2y = 6. Then the directrix of P2 is x + 2y = ____________.

questions.question_text: Identify the pair of physical quantities that have same dimensions:

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The distance between Sun and Earth is R. The duration of year if the distance between Sun and Earth becomes 3R will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A stone of mass m, tied to a string is being whirled in a vertical circle with a uniform speed. The tension in the string is

option_texts.B: minimum at the highest position of the circular path.
option_texts.C: minimum at the lowest position of the circular path.
option_texts.D: minimum when the rope is in the horizontal position.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two identical charged particles each having a  mass 10 g and charge 2.0 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$7C are placed on a horizontal table with a separation of L between them such that they stay in limited equilibrium. If the coefficient of friction between each particle and the table is 0.25, find the value of L. [Use g = 10 ms$$-$$2]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two massless springs with spring constants 2 k and 9 k, carry 50 g and 100 g masses at their free ends. These two masses oscillate vertically such that their maximum velocities are equal. Then, the ratio of their respective amplitudes will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What will be the most suitable combination of three resistors A = 2$$\Omega$$, B = 4$$\Omega$$, C = 6$$\Omega$$ so that $$\left( {{{22} \over 3}} \right)$$$$\Omega$$ is equivalent resistance of combination?

option_texts.A: Parallel combination of A and C connected in series with B.
option_texts.B: Parallel combination of A and B connected in series with C.
option_texts.C: Series combination of A and C connected in parallel with B.
option_texts.D: Series combination of B and C connected in parallel with A.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The soft-iron is a suitable material for making an electromagnet. This is because soft-iron has

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A proton, a deutron and an $$\alpha$$-particle with same kinetic energy enter into a uniform magnetic field at right angle to magnetic field. The ratio of the radii of their respective circular paths is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : The reactance of an ac circuit is zero. It is possible that the circuit contains a capacitor and an inductor.

Statement II : In ac circuit, the average power delivered by the source never becomes zero.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
option_texts.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
option_texts.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
option_texts.D: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Potential energy as a function of r is given by $$U = {A \over {{r^{10}}}} - {B \over {{r^5}}}$$, where r is the interatomic distance, A and B are positive constants. The equilibrium distance between the two atoms will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An object of mass 5 kg is thrown vertically upwards from the ground. The air resistance produces a constant retarding force of 10 N throughout the motion. The ratio of time of ascent to the time of descent will be equal to : [Use g = 10 ms$$-$$2].

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A fly wheel is accelerated uniformly from rest and rotates through 5 rad in the first second. The angle rotated by the fly wheel in the next second, will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A 100 g of iron nail is hit by a 1.5 kg hammer striking at a velocity of 60 ms$$-$$1. What will be the rise in the temperature of the nail if one fourth of energy of the hammer goes into heating the nail?

[Specific heat capacity of iron = 0.42 Jg$$-$$1 $$^\circ$$C$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If the charge on a capacitor is increased by 2 C, the energy stored in it increases by 44%. The original charge on the capacitor is (in C)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A long cylindrical volume contains a uniformly distributed charge of density $$\rho$$. The radius of cylindrical volume is R. A charge particle (q) revolves around the cylinder in a circular path. The kinetic energy of the particle is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An electric bulb is rated as 200 W. What will be the peak magnetic field at 4 m distance produced by the radiations coming from this bulb? Consider this bulb as a point source with 3.5% efficiency.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The light of two different frequencies whose photons have energies 3.8 eV and 1.4 eV respectively, illuminate a metallic surface whose work function is 0.6 eV successively. The ratio of maximum speeds of emitted electrons for the two frequencies respectively will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two light beams of intensities in the ratio of 9 : 4 are allowed to interfere. The ratio of the intensity of maxima and minima will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In Bohr's atomic model of hydrogen, let K, P and E are the kinetic energy, potential energy and total energy of the electron respectively. Choose the correct option when the electron undergoes transitions to a higher level :

option_texts.A: All K, P and E increase.
option_texts.B: K decreases, P and E increase.
option_texts.C: P decreases, K and E increase.
option_texts.D: K increases, P and E decrease.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A body is projected from the ground at an angle of 45$$^\circ$$ with the horizontal. Its velocity after 2s is 20 ms$$-$$1. The maximum height reached by the body during its motion is __________ m. (use g = 10 ms$$-$$2)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Two travelling waves of equal amplitudes and equal frequencies move in opposite directions along a string. They interfere to produce a stationary wave whose equation is given by $$y = (10\cos \pi x\sin {{2\pi t} \over T})$$ cm

The amplitude of the particle at $$x = {4 \over 3}$$ cm will be ___________ cm.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In the given circuit, the value of current IL will be ____________ mA. (When RL = 1k$$\Omega$$)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A ray of light is incident at an angle of incidence 60$$^\circ$$ on the glass slab of refractive index $$\sqrt3$$. After refraction, the light ray emerges out from other parallel faces and lateral shift between incident ray and emergent ray is 4$$\sqrt3$$ cm. The thickness of the glass slab is __________ cm.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A circular coil of 1000 turns each with area 1m2 is rotated about its vertical diameter at the rate of one revolution per second in a uniform horizontal magnetic field of 0.07T. The maximum voltage generation will be ___________ V.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A monoatomic gas performs a work of $${Q \over {4}}$$ where Q is the heat supplied to it. The molar heat capacity of the gas will be ______________ R during this transformation. Where R is the gas constant.
